channel.title: Shell scripts?
channel.description: i really need someone to write the shell scripts for Fedora Core 5 to run the runserver, compiler, and something to turn the server off for my private server i am trying to get it to run on a VPS

@moparisthebest wrote:

That is the correct command, but the class ‘server’ needs to be in the same directory that you launch that command in.

item.title: Shell scripts?
item.dc:creator: @_k1tz $k1tz
item.description:
@_k1tz wrote:

yeh thanks[br][size=1]Posted on: April 10, 2007, 12:36:28 PM[/size][hr]can u give me the exact scripts for compile and runserver plz[br][size=1]Posted on: April 10, 2007, 12:39:25 PM[/size][hr]so if i execute my runserver.sh
java -Xmx500m -cp .:./jython.jar:./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar server

it should work?[br][size=1]Posted on: April 10, 2007, 12:42:20 PM[/size][hr]
Exception in thread “main” java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: server
at gnu.java.lang.MainThread.run(libgcj.so.7)
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: server not found in gnu.gcj.runtime.SystemClassLoader{urls=[file:./], parent=gnu.gcj.runtime.ExtensionClassLoader{urls=[], parent=null}}
at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(libgcj.so.7)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(libgcj.so.7)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(libgcj.so.7)
at java.lang.Class.forName(libgcj.so.7)
at gnu.java.lang.MainThread.run(libgcj.so.7)

item.title: Shell scripts?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

The commands are identical to window’s batch files with one slight difference

In windows, the seperator is ‘;’ and in linux it is ‘:’, for example:

java -cp .;./bcel.jar SomeProgram <- windows
java -cp .:./bcel.jar SomeProgram <- linux

Hopefully that is helpful to you.

Read full topic
